The term surface tension first appears in textbooks during middle or high school and is familiar even to those with little interest in science. Everyone knows surface tension, but not everyone understands surface tension.

Fig. 2. Molecules in the bulk and at the liquid/gas interface. While the one in the bulk is in the presence of isotropic interactions with adjacent molecules, the one at the interface is in the absence of half its cohesive interactions.
